nodes.bodyText: This may have gotten lost in translation, but I think we should skip the null check. Accessors are "internal" APIs, so if the values they receive are null, then it's a bug. I think we decided that any public method parameter without a @Nullable annotation should be assumed not to be null except when it comes to objects received in REST requests.
Sorry! I apparently read the opposite of what you said. I've removed the null checks and the associated tests.
We can remove this check for the same reason as below.
